name: Saurians
background:
Saurians are an ancient coalition of humanoid reptiles led by giant Frog-Mages. They fight alongside a variety of powerful dinosaur-like creatures from the jungles of their native plane. 

The Saurians put their faith in the prophecies of the Frog-Mages, who believed that they would confront Havoc in order to save their world. With the opening of the Rift, however, it appears that they have returned too late. Now, they must confront the apparent failure of the ruling Frog-Mages and their prophecy.
backgroundFull:
The Frog-Mages claim that they came into being in a time long before any other species arrived in Tyria. They grew wise and powerful with the use of magical waters, developing powerful magic. They found themselves amongst unthinking creatures, and so they began to share their knowledge with the surrounding animals. Soon, these animals changed in body and mind, becoming intelligent and learning to walk and use tools, and they came to revere the Frog-Mages as their gods. 

The Frog-Magesâ€™ skill in magic soon drew the eyes of the Havoc Gods, who sought their power. A long war ensued between the Saurians and the Daemons of the Havoc Gods, which soon became locked in a stalemate without a clear path in sight. 

The Frog-Mages turned to prophecy to divine a path for their people. They told their people three Great Prophecies: Without the Saurians, the world would burn. Without them, the world would heal. Without them, the world would break.

Without a means to overcome the Daemons, the Saurians opened Voidgates and retreated into a plane where they could be safe from them. They entered into a long hibernation and rested while the Havoc Gods ransacked and burnt their plane. They hoped that when they awoke to return, their home would have healed, and once they returned, their presence would ensure that the world could not break so long as they remained there. 

Now the re-awakened Saurians have begun to arrive in Tyria. They have learnt about the release of the Havoc Gods and the Rift with much sorrow. Some Saurians believe that it is a sign that the Frog-Mages failed in their plan to forestall the third part of the prophecy, and that the victory of Havoc is now inevitable. Others fear that some greater threat still lurks in the future, which the Frog-Mages hope to prevent. 

Uncertainty is a strange sentiment for the Saurians and their Frog-Mages, but they are not unprepared. Skilled warriors with a proud tradition of fighting Havoc, the Saurians are ready to face whatever dangers Tyria holds for them, even if it means their ultimate doom. 

How will you face your destiny?

spells.name: Poison Mist
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Shred when attacking against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Piranha Swarm
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with Disintegrate.

spells.name: Fateful Guidance
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Steadfast once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration

spells.name: Serpent Egg
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 6", which take 3 hits with Bane each.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Primal
specialRules.description: For each unmodified roll of 6 to hit when attacking, this model may roll +1 attack with that weapon. This rule doesnâ€™t apply to newly generated attacks.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Precision Target
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. Friendly units get +X to hit rolls when attacking it.

specialRules.name: Crossing Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, once during its activation when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them, and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Protection Feat
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this unit takes wounds and all its models have this rule, you may use this rule and roll one die per wound, and on a 4+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Heavy Impact
specialRules.description: Counts as having Impact(X) with hits that have AP(1).

specialRules.name: Good Shot
specialRules.description: This model gets +1 to hit rolls when shooting.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Evasive
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Rapid Charge Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game moves +4" when using Charge actions. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Counter-Attack. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ravage
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one wound.

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Rending in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Hit & Run Shooter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Disintegrate
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 3+, this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Shred Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Shred when attacking against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Primal Boost Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 friendly units within 12", which gets Primal Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Impact
specialRules.description: Roll X dice when attacking after charging, unless fatigued. For each 2+ the target takes one hit.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Counter
specialRules.description: Strikes first with this weapon when charged, and the charging unit gets -1 total Impact rolls per model with Counter.

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Hit & Run
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Shooter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Primal Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Primal, it gets extra attacks on successful unmodified hit results of 5-6 from Primal (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Steadfast
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule is Shaken at the beginning of the round, roll one die. On a 4+, it stops being Shaken.
